required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Beneficial Effect of Intravenous Magnesium Sulphate in Term Neonates With Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy(HIE)
clinical_study.official_title: Beneficial Effect of Intravenous Magnesium Sulphate in Term Neonates With Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy(HIE)

lead_sponsor.agency: Services Institute of Medical Sciences, Pakistan

clinical_study.source: Services Institute of Medical Sciences, Pakistan

brief_summary.textblock: Neonatal mortality rate is the highest in Pakistan. And Birth Asphyxia is one of the main reversible causes. Outcomes related to birth asphyxia can be improved, if intervention done in time with proper measures. MgSO4 is cheaper and easily available drug.

detailed_description.textblock: Some studies showed positive results if given within 6 hours of birth asphyxia, whereas some are not supportive. But still less know about this drug, especially in low income countries. Objective of this study is to see beneficial effects of MgSO4 in neonates presenting with birth asphyxia.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in Immediate complications of disease
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in Immediate complications of disease

arm_group.description: MgSO4 1st dose within 6 hours of life @250mg/kg,2nd after 24 hours of life @250mg/kg, 3rd after 48 hours of life @250mg/kg. Monitoring and Protective measures: Before and during administration of MgSO4, B.P, Capillary refill time, Heart rate and respiratory rate will be assessed closely i-e on 10 minutes interval, infusion of MgSO4 will be give over 30 minutes and baby will be monitored every 15 minutes interval after completion of infusion as well for 1 hour.

intervention.description: Before and during administration of MgSO4, B.P, Capillary refill time, Heart rate and respiratory rate will be assessed closely i-e on 10 minutes interval, infusion of MgSO4 will be give over 30 minutes and baby will be monitored every 15 minutes interval after completion of infusion as well for 1 hour.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- After informed consent, any child who is term, inborn or out born fulfilling the definition of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy according to history, apgar or scoring system and reaching within 6 hours of delivery in nursery department of pediatric medicine unit-II, Services Hospital, Lahore
Exclusion Criteria:
- Preterm Syndromic/dysmorphic child Term child with HIE and arriving after 6 hours of life. Term child with unrelated co morbidities eg congenital heart defects, Renal failure etc

facility.name: Services Institute of Medical Sciences, Lahore

reference.citation: Gathwala G, Khera A, Singh J, Balhara B. Magnesium for neuroprotection in birth asphyxia. J Pediatr Neurosci. 2010 Jul;5(2):102-4. doi: 10.4103/1817-1745.76094.

patient_data.ipd_description: After family consent, decision will be reviewed
